eu.stratosphere.nephele.template

Class AbstractInvokable

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.stratosphere.nephele.template.AbstractInvokable
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractInputTask, AbstractOutputTask, AbstractTask

    public abstract class AbstractInvokable
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract base class for every task class in Nephele.
    Author:
    warneke

      Must be overwritten by the concrete task.

      Sets the environment of this task.

    • Method Detail

      • registerInputOutput

        public abstract void registerInputOutput()
        Must be overwritten by the concrete task to instantiate the required record reader and record writer.

      • invoke

        public abstract void invoke()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Must be overwritten by the concrete task. This method is called by the task manager when the actual execution of the task starts.
        Throws:
        Execution - thrown if any exception occurs during the execution of the tasks
        java.lang.Exception

      • setEnvironment

        public final void setEnvironment(Environment environment)
        Sets the environment of this task.
        Parameters:
        environment - the environment of this task

      • getEnvironment

        public Environment getEnvironment()
        Returns the environment of this task.
        Returns:
        the environment of this task or null if the environment has not yet been set

      • checkConfiguration

        public void checkConfiguration()
                        throws IllegalConfigurationException
        Overwrite this method to implement task specific checks if the respective task has been configured properly.
        Throws:
        IllegalConfigurationException - thrown if the respective tasks is not configured properly

      • getMinimumNumberOfSubtasks

        public int getMinimumNumberOfSubtasks()
        Overwrite this method to provide the minimum number of subtasks the respective task must be split into at runtime.
        Returns:
        the minimum number of subtasks the respective task must be split into at runtime

      • getMaximumNumberOfSubtasks

        public int getMaximumNumberOfSubtasks()
        Overwrite this method to provide the maximum number of subtasks the respective task can be split into at runtime.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of subtasks the respective task can be split into at runtime, -1 for infinity

      • userThreadStarted

        public final void userThreadStarted(java.lang.Thread userThread)
        This method should be called by the user code if a custom user thread has been started.
        Parameters:
        userThread - the user thread which has been started

      • userThreadFinished

        public final void userThreadFinished(java.lang.Thread userThread)
        This method should be called by the user code if a custom user thread has finished.
        Parameters:
        userThread - the user thread which has finished

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
            throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is called when a task is canceled either as a result of a user abort or an execution failure. It can be overwritten to respond to shut down the user code properly.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - thrown if any exception occurs during the execution of the user code
